page.title: 14TOWPATH WALK CONTINUED
page.content: BOATS REGULARLY PASSED THROUGH THE VILLAGE CARRYING RAW UNSWEETENED CHOCO- LATE FOR CADBURYS FACTORY AT KNIGHTON. LOCAL BOYS WOULD TEASE THE BOATMEN IN THE HOPE THAT THEY WOULD THROW CHUNKS OF RAW CHOCOLATE AT THEM.WHEN HAY WAS CARRIED ON THE BOATS,AN EXTENSION WAS FITTED TO THE RUDDER SO THAT THE BARGEE COULD SIT ON TOP OF THE PILED UP HAY AND STEER. THE BOATS MOORED ALONG THE SIDE OF THE CANAL HAVE A REGISTERED NUMBER,JUST LIKE MOTOR VEHICLES.TAX HAS TO BE PAID TO THE WATERWAYS BOARD BEFORE YOU CAN PUT A BOAT ON A CANAL. AFTER PASSING THE WAREHOUSE THE CANAL CROSSES OVER THE VILLAGE BROOK.THE BUILDING YOU CAN SEE BELOW THE CANAL IS THE VILLAGE SCOUT AND GUIDE HUT. THE DERELICT LOCK COTTAGE WAS DESIGNED BY THOMAS TELFORD.THERE IS A CENTRAL CHIMNEY WITH ROOMS ARRANGED ROUND IT.
